description: a(n) = |{m : multiplicative order of 3 mod m = n}|.
comments: The multiplicative order of a mod m, GCD(a,m)=1, is the smallest natural number d for which a^d = 1 (mod m). a(n) = number of orders of degree-n monic irreducible polynomials over GF(3).
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100
formula: a(n) = Sum_{ d divides n } mu(n/d)*tau(3^d-1), (mu(n) = Moebius function A008683, tau(n) = number of divisors of n A000005).
maple: with(numtheory); A059885 := proc(n) local d,s; s := 0; for d in divisors(n) do s := s+mobius(n/d)*tau(3^d-1); od; RETURN(s); end;
mathematica: a[n_] := Sum[ MoebiusMu[n/d] * DivisorSigma[0, 3^d - 1], {d, Divisors[n]}]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 62} ] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Dec 12 2012 *)
crossrefs: Column k=3 of A212957. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 12 2012
author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 06 2001
